title: [SETUP-BUG]; [R]; [mlflow]
body:
Hi,

I'm new to mlflow and cannot seem to get the installation for R correct in the Windows 10 environment.  
**Below is the output of mlflow::install_mlflow()**
I've tried everything even mlflow::install_mlflow("3.9") or python_version = 3.9.
In Rstudio I've changed my Global Option for Python to :  C:/Users/grayh/AppData/Local/Programs/Python/Python39/python.exe
this seemed to resolve some issues but not the below issue
I also ensured the default on the **Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Python\PythonCore\3.9** is set to C:\Users\...\Python\Python39\python.exe

_I've pretty much ensured (imo) that I don't have python3.6 anywhere on my machine???_

**Output**
Collecting package metadata (current_repodata.json): ...working... done
Solving environment: ...working... failed with initial frozen solve. Retrying with flexible solve.
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): ...working... done
Solving environment: ...working... failed with initial frozen solve. Retrying with flexible solve.
                                                                           0:00,  6.47it/s]        
Found conflicts! Looking for incompatible packages.
This can take several minutes.  Press CTRL-C to abort.
failed

UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found
to be incompatible with the existing python installation in your environment:

Specifications:

  - mlflow==1.21.0 -> python[version='>=3.7,<3.8.0a0|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0|>=3.9,<3.10.0a0']

Your python: python=3.6

If python is on the left-most side of the chain, that's the version you've asked for.
When python appears to the right, that indicates that the thing on the left is somehow
not available for the python version you are constrained to. Note that conda will not
change your python version to a different minor version unless you explicitly specify
that.
